title: Ticket #1618: Directory::Remove_Entry() causes issues when passed a NULL entry name
description:
Directory::Remove_Entry() removes the entire directory in which the Directory object was constructed with when passed a NULL entry name. 
Directory dir(original_dir.Value());
bool ret_val = dir.Remove_Entry(NULL);
In this case the directory specified in original_dir.Value() will be removed, which could be bad.

The unit test output: 
TEST:  Test that Remove_Entry() returns false for a NULL entry.
INPUT:
    Directory:  /scratch/slauson/git-build/src/condor_unit_tests
    Entry:  NULL
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  FALSE
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  TRUE
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 2167 (0.006523 seconds)
remarks:
2010-Aug-27 14:20:31 by slauson:
I checked for call sites of Remove_Entry() and there don't appear to be any. So removing the method entirely would be a simple fix. It doesn't do anything special and can be substituted with Remove_Full_Path() or Find_Named_Entry() followed by Remove_Current_File().
check_ins: 2010-Sep-01 13:46   Check-in [18906]: Removed Directory::Remove_Entry() method. It had some issues and wasn't being used anywhere. #1618 (By Josh Slauson )
